reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love Mother Nature and highly respect the Native American culture. Indy Quillen does a masterful job of sharing the wisdom of both.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great story of wilderness and nature.
reviews.reviewText: Very exciting adventure story . Full of strong positive messages of love of nature, courage, friendship and loyalty. Really enjoyed it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
reviews.reviewText: A serial killer is amongst us, "The Art Critic" was the moniker given to this person.Fox Walker is a Native American who belongs to the Shoshone Tribe, is tracker and survivalist who occasionally works for law in Elk Meadow, Colorado.The SherIff of Elk Meadow has called Fox Walker to help find a missing hiker. In reality it's a woman whom they find, who has no recollection of her past. She was discovered by Fox Walker who while tracking discovered footprints 👣👣on the trail which eventually lead him to a clearing, where he saw 👀a young tanned blonde girl. She was dressed in cut-offs , her hair hid her upper body, she had no top on. She was named by the media as "The Wild Woman Of Gray Forest."This serial killer has been murdering young woman who were involved with "Art." He left these women with carved lines on their bodies which were eventually described as Japanese symbols. He always left the bodies in forests around Colorado and in other surrounding states.The FBI were also involved with these murders.This young wild woman called herself "Nataya," which is a Shoshone name. Fox Walker somehow won over the trust of this woman of The Gray Forest. This mysterious serial killer located where Nataya was staying and stalked out the location, which was Fox Walker 's cabin. She was the only woman who escaped from him;and now he's READY to finish what he left.This a mystery worth reading and it will KEEP your suspense going until very end. This adventure explores the spiritual world of the Native Americans and these spirits are part of the make-up of "Nataya." Everyone's burdens aren't always easy to unload; sometimes those burdens will lead you down a road of no return, this may have been "The Art Critic's"many psychotic disorders. It's hard to make that decision, this author tickles your mind or maybe the path she guides you down will lead you to why these deaths occurred.Indy Quillen, author, joins the club along with James Patterson and other great mystery writers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely fabulous mystery! Woman with amnesia living in the wild. Serial killer on the lose. First Nation Hunter, tracker, and survivor on the hunt.A cast of interesting supporting characters! A great story to keep your interest throughout the book. Enjoy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2022
reviews.reviewText: As with a lot of the e-books I read there is the over use of the word 'that'. Good editing would catch the miss use and over use of the word 'that'. I found other editing errors that detract from the story and, for me, require determination to continue. The story was excellent and engaging. I want to read the next book but I am put off by the lazy editing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good start
reviews.reviewText: Well done for her apparent first novel. The plot line is interesting and the characters well done. I felt it got a little soft towards the end, somewhat jumbled with a few loose ends, but I will definitely try another of hers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loved this book!
reviews.reviewText: Thank goodness I found this book. Wonderful story. The characters came alive. I look forward to reading more books by Indy Quillen. Thank you for sharing this story and keep the words flowing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I grew up on the “Hatchet” series and really wanted to get into reading similar books again. Loved it! I was so excited when I learned there are three more books in this series! The book kept me engaged the entire time with no fry spots. The author captures the thoughts and whereabouts of each character perfectly. Really enjoyed it! Can’t wait to read the rest of the series!
Eine sehr spannende Geschichte, wunderbar geschrieben. Macht Lust auf die Fortsetzung. Ich könnte mir die Verfilmung sehr gut vorstellen.
